ygData.messageBody:
At 08:55 PM 6/2/00 +0000, you wrote:
>But it is a client side issue... if the client is set to not drop,
>the command never gets sent to the server that something is being
>dropped. The client decides the action first.

i don't think it's that clear that the client decides the action. the server
keeps track of all the locations of objects. the locations of objects (other
characters and npcs) determines what function is called, drop/trade/give/etc.
it would make much more sense to have the whole drop/trade/give/etc code
on the server side. in other words the client can just send a mouse_click_happened
interrupt along with x/y/z coordinates of the mouse location in the window.
then the server decides what to do with it.
